meanings.definition: A product of one's creative thinking or work.
meanings.sent1: Her painting was a beautiful brainchild of her imagination.
meanings.sent2: The new app was his latest brainchild and it was a huge success.
meanings.sent3: The brainchild of the chef's experiment was a surprisingly tasty dish.
meanings.sent4: The novel was the brainchild of the author's late-night inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The sculpture stood as a testament to the artist's brilliant brainchild.

meanings.sent1: His latest business venture was a risky brainchild that paid off.
meanings.sent2: The invention of the light bulb was Thomas Edison's famous brainchild.
meanings.sent3: The brainchild of the student's science project impressed the entire class.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur's successful company was his greatest brainchild.
meanings.sent5: The musician's hit song was a catchy brainchild that resonated with many.
